alert.note: Alert for Sharkey (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 22 at 11:59AM CDT until March 22 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN WARREN...YAZOO...EAST CENTRAL ISSAQUENA AND SOUTHEASTERN SHARKEY COUNTIES... At 1158 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Holly Bluff to 8 miles northwest of Phoenix to near Oak Ridge, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Tinsley around 1215 PM CDT. Yazoo City and Little Yazoo around 1225 PM CDT. Myrleville around 1230 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Satartia and Bentonia. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for central and west central Mississippi. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
